file_content.text: We'll try to exercise a bit more caution from now on.
The droids appear to have lost interest in us. No doubt they're hunting down their new prey.
Now the Republic can enjoy being slaughtered by these antiquated tools of destruction. I'm in your debt.
Be careful about what you set loose in the future.
Don't let this happen again.
Wise words. I don't think I have the manpower to suffer another incident like this.
Not a problem.
I've got to go.
Yes, of course.
Now that those droids aren't shooting us anymore, we may be able to deactivate a few and study them more closely.
In time, we may even be able to replicate their technology. Belsavis is more intriguing than I feared....
Don't let yourself get overwhelmed by those war droids. They're extremely deadly en masse.
It's a relief to see you here, my lord. Don't mind the troops' sulking. Being reduced to cannon fodder isn't sitting well with them.
I hope you're for hire, bounty hunter. I've had it with these troops--a few bloodbaths and they become impossible to motivate.
Welcome, sir. Ignore the troops around here... fear has made them a bit prickly.
Ah, welcome. Don't let the troops' gloominess alarm you. Their expendability is starting to get to them.
This prison is far more dangerous than we originally thought... and far older.
Many of these vaults were constructed thousands of years before the Republic came. Imagine the secrets inside.
I doubt whoever built those vaults just filled them with loot.
You mean "imprisoned" inside.
Yes, the contents of these vaults tend to be more dangerous than valuable, as we've discovered....
If the Republic didn't build the vaults, who did?
Where'd they come from?
Some long-forgotten alien race. They used the vaults to imprison all the vile monstrosities they didn't want running amok.
So?
We've been blasting open the older vaults in hopes that whatever horrors were locked away might turn on the Republic guards.
In one vault, we discovered ancient war droids--ungrateful wretches that vaporized my men on the spot. Now they're on the warpath.
And you want me to destroy them.
So it's my problem now.
Actually, no.
What were a bunch of old battle droids doing locked up?
Why were they imprisoned?
Perhaps for exhibiting the same genocidal tendencies they've been demonstrating all week. Still, they may have their uses.
You brought this on yourself.
This is your fault.
We figured they'd attack the Republic, but most of the guards have already fled the area. They would do well to keep running.
Those droids, properly controlled, would be invaluable. However, our reprogramming spikes need to be inserted manually.
Lost thirty men trying to dominate the ancient droids. Validating, in a way, but these massacres are crippling us. I need your help uploading those spikes.
There may yet be a way to recover from your blunder.
I'll fix your mistake.
If we don't harness their power, the Republic will.
We can't pass this up.
No sense killing something when you can get it to kill for you instead.
It's a good plan.
This situation calls for skill and subtlety, not sheer numbers.
I'll do it my way.
It won't be easy.
Once installed, the spikes are designed to make the droids target only people wearing Republic guard uniforms.
Until then, though, those droids will be extremely hostile. If they get you in their sights, they won't let up. And they don't miss.
I'd get killed. [Refuse quest]
That's what everyone says. I guess "death and glory for the Empire" just doesn't motivate people like it used to.
There's more to this prison than meets the eye.
